channel.title: Cannot access onion sites
channel.description:
Hello,
I've got anothet problem with Whonix-Workstation. So I've tried to configure this type of tunneling: Tor -> VPN. On WW I configured openvpn client, changed in `/etc/resolv.conf nameserver` to DNS server of my VPN provider, connected to VPN and after that started tor with transproxy: `TOR_TRANSPROXY=1 torbrowser` Everything is ok. After that I've disbled openvpn connection, and put `nameserver 10.152.152.10` to `/etc/resolv.conf` and started Tor Browser as usual. I'm connected to TOR, according to check.torproject but I can't connect to .onion sites now. I get "Problem loading page' error. What I've did wrong?

item.title: Cannot access onion sites
item.dc:creator: monk
item.description:
I’ve just reinstalled TorBrowser and everything is OK.
I installed another Tor Browser. So I use one as normal TB, and another with transproxy option.

Thank you for help anyway

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access onion sites
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
monk:

TOR_TRANSPROXY=1 torbrowser

As explained under https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Remove_Proxy_Settings under Undo, this cannot be easily undone. So you’d also have to start with a fresh Tor Browser. Use https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Tor_Browser_Downloader_by_Whonix

Or easiest… If you messed up some setting… Why not just start with a fresh Whonix-Workstation.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access onion sites
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

Did you try restarting or reloading the connection via the Gateway?

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access onion sites
item.dc:creator: monk
item.description:
You don’t understand.
For the first time, I use tunneling.
user -> Tor -> VPN -> Internet
But then I disabled openvpn, so there was
user -> Tor -> internet
and I was connected to Tor, but had no possibility to connect to .onion sites.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access onion sites
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Nothing.

user -> Tor -> proxy/VPN/SSH -> internet breaks Tor onion service connectivity. No way around that. This is because in order to talk to onion, traffic must be sent through Tor. But in user -> Tor -> proxy/VPN/SSH -> internet case, only the VPN talks to Tor. Browser is talking to the VPN, which is incapable to speak onion.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access onion sites
item.dc:creator: monk
item.description:
Hello,

I’ve got anothet problem with Whonix-Workstation.
So I’ve tried to configure this type of tunneling: Tor -> VPN.
On WW I configured openvpn client, changed in /etc/resolv.conf nameserver to DNS server of my VPN provider, connected to VPN and after that started tor with transproxy:
TOR_TRANSPROXY=1 torbrowser
Everything is ok.
After that I’ve disbled openvpn connection, and put
nameserver 10.152.152.10 to /etc/resolv.conf
and started Tor Browser as usual. I’m connected to TOR, according to check.torproject but I can’t connect to .onion sites now. I get "Problem loading page’ error.
What I’ve did wrong?

Read full topic
